meanings.definition: Fringiest: superlative form of fringe, meaning having the most fringe
meanings.sent1: Her dress was the fringiest at the party, with tassels everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The jacket with the fringiest sleeves caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The fringiest pillow in the room looked like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: The fringiest tree in the forest seemed to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The fringiest curtain in the theater shimmered under the stage lights.

meanings.definition: Fringiest: superlative form of fringe, meaning located on the outskirts or periphery
meanings.sent1: Their house was the fringiest in the neighborhood, right by the woods.
meanings.sent2: The fringiest shops in town were hidden in the corners of the market.
meanings.sent3: Living in the fringiest part of town gave them a sense of peace.
meanings.sent4: The fringiest clouds on the horizon signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The fringiest flowers along the path added a touch of color to the outskirts.

meanings.definition: Fringiest: superlative form of fringe, meaning unconventional or on the edge of society
meanings.sent1: The artist's style was the fringiest, blending colors in unique ways.
meanings.sent2: She always wore the fringiest accessories, standing out in a crowd.
meanings.sent3: The fringiest cafe in town served coffee in mugs made of chocolate.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were the fringiest, pushing boundaries in every direction.
meanings.sent5: The fringiest music genre combined sounds from around the world.
